meanings.def: a long distance away
examples: We didn't go far.
Have you come far?
It's not far to the beach.
There's not far to go now.
It's too far to walk.
+ adv./prep. The restaurant is not far from here.
countries as far apart as Japan and Brazil
He looked down at the traffic far below.
Far away in the distance, a train whistled.
The farther north they went, the colder it became.
a concert of music from near and far
(figurative) Legends are usually far removed from the reality.

meanings.def: used when you are asking or talking about the distance between two places or the distance that has been travelled or is to be travelled
examples: How far is it to your house from here?
How far is Boston from New York?
How much further is it?
I'm not sure I can walk so far.
as far as somebody/something We'll go by train as far as London, and then take a bus.
We didn't go as far as the others.

meanings.def: a long time from the present; for a large part of a particular period of time
examples: far back The band had their first hit as far back as 2012.
To answer that question we need to go further back in time.
far ahead Let's try to plan further ahead.
far into something We worked far into the night.
The film takes place in a future not too far distant.

meanings.def: very much; to a great degree
examples: That's a far better idea.
The damage was far worse than I'd expected.
a drug that gives heart attack victims a far greater chance of survival
There are far more opportunities for young people than there used to be.
She always gives us far too much homework.
The results far exceeded my expectations.
The benefits far outweigh the cost.
The recent heat and continued drought further reduced yields.
far beyond (something) It had been a success far beyond their expectations.
far behind (something) He's fallen far behind in his work.

meanings.def: used when you are asking or talking about the degree to which something is true or possible
examples: How far can we trust him?
as far as… His parents supported him as far as they could.
Plan your route in advance, using main roads as far as possible.

meanings.def: used to talk about how much progress has been made in doing or achieving something
examples: How far have you got with that report?
Half an hour later Duncan was no farther in his quest.
as/so far as something I read as far as the third chapter.
as/so far as doing something We’ve got as far as collecting our data but we haven’t analysed it yet.

meanings.def: to the horizon (= where the sky meets the land or sea)
examples: The bleak moorland stretched on all sides as far as the eye could see.

meanings.def: used to give your personal opinion on something
examples: As far as I am concerned, you can do what you like.

meanings.def: used to say that you think you know, remember, understand, etc. something but you cannot be completely sure, especially because you do not know all the facts
examples: As far as we knew, there was no cause for concern.
As far as I can see, you've done nothing wrong.
She lived in Chicago, as far as I can remember.

meanings.def: used to give facts or an opinion about a particular aspect of something
examples: She's doing fine as far as French is concerned, it's her German I'm worried about.

meanings.def: to a limited degree, usually less than is enough
examples: It's a good plan as far as it goes, but there are a lot of things they haven't thought of.

meanings.def: by a great amount
examples: The last of these reasons is by far the most important.
Amy is the smartest by far.

meanings.def: to continue doing something beyond reasonable limits
far away from home; to or in places that are not near
examples: You can hire a car if you want to explore further afield.
Journalists came from as far afield as China.

meanings.def: by a very great amount
examples: She's far and away the best player.

meanings.def: over a large area
examples: They searched far and wide for the missing child.
People came from far and wide for the show.

meanings.def: used when you are just about to disagree with somebody or to criticize them and you would like them to think that you do not really want to do this
examples: Far be it from me to interfere in your affairs but I would like to give you just one piece of advice.

meanings.def: almost the opposite of something or of what is expected
examples: It is far from clear (= it is not clear) what he intends to do.
Computers, far from destroying jobs, can create employment.

meanings.def: used to say that the opposite of what somebody says is true
examples: ‘You're not angry then?’ ‘Far from it. I've never laughed so much in my life.’

meanings.def: not happening often
to be very successful in the future
examples: She is very talented and should go far.

meanings.def: to achieve all that is wanted
examples: The new legislation is welcome but does not go far enough.
Do these measures go far enough?
(disapproving) Stop it now. The joke has gone far enough (= it has continued too long).

meanings.def: to be willing to go to extreme or surprising limits in dealing with something
examples: I wouldn't go as far as to say that he's a liar (= but I think he may be slightly dishonest).
In June 2009 he went so far as to offer his resignation.

meanings.def: to behave in an extreme way that is not acceptable
examples: He's always been quite crude, but this time he's gone too far.
I never thought she'd go this far.

meanings.def: to the degree that
examples: That's the truth, in so far as I know it.

meanings.def: almost correct
examples: Your guess wasn't far out at all.
They weren't far out with their estimate of 100 000.
You're not far wrong when you say he's the richest guy in town.

meanings.def: to not be enough to buy a lot of things
examples: Five pounds doesn't go very far these days.

meanings.def: to not be enough for what is needed
examples: Four bottles of wine won't go far among twenty people.

meanings.def: until now; up to this point
examples: What do you think of the show so far?
Detectives are so far at a loss to explain the reason for his death.

meanings.def: only to a limited degree
examples: I trust him only so far.

meanings.def: used to say that things have been successful until now and you hope that they will continue to be successful, but you know that the task, etc. is not finished yet
used to comment on something that was almost successful but in fact failed

idioms.idiom: as far as the eye can/could see
idioms.def: to the horizon (= where the sky meets the land or sea)
examples: The bleak moorland stretched on all sides as far as the eye could see.
I have to travel further/​farther to work now.
Let’s consider this point further.
Are there any further questions?

idioms.idiom: as/so far as I am concerned
idioms.def: used to give your personal opinion on something
examples: As far as I am concerned, you can do what you like.

idioms.idiom: as far as I know | as far as I can remember, see, tell, etc.
idioms.def: used to say that you think you know, remember, understand, etc. something but you cannot be completely sure, especially because you do not know all the facts
examples: As far as we knew, there was no cause for concern.
As far as I can see, you've done nothing wrong.
She lived in Chicago, as far as I can remember.

idioms.idiom: as/so far as somebody/something is concerned
idioms.def: used to give facts or an opinion about a particular aspect of something
examples: She's doing fine as far as French is concerned, it's her German I'm worried about.

idioms.def: to a limited degree, usually less than is enough
examples: It's a good plan as far as it goes, but there are a lot of things they haven't thought of.

idioms.def: by a great amount
examples: The last of these reasons is by far the most important.
Amy is the smartest by far.

idioms.def: to continue doing something beyond reasonable limits
far away from home; to or in places that are not near
examples: You can hire a car if you want to explore further afield.
Journalists came from as far afield as China.

idioms.def: by a very great amount
examples: She's far and away the best player.

idioms.def: over a large area
examples: They searched far and wide for the missing child.
People came from far and wide for the show.

idioms.idiom: far be it from me to do something (but…)
idioms.def: used when you are just about to disagree with somebody or to criticize them and you would like them to think that you do not really want to do this
examples: Far be it from me to interfere in your affairs but I would like to give you just one piece of advice.

idioms.def: almost the opposite of something or of what is expected
examples: It is far from clear (= it is not clear) what he intends to do.
Computers, far from destroying jobs, can create employment.

idioms.def: used to say that the opposite of what somebody says is true
examples: ‘You're not angry then?’ ‘Far from it. I've never laughed so much in my life.’

idioms.def: not happening often
to be very successful in the future
examples: She is very talented and should go far.

idioms.def: to achieve all that is wanted
examples: The new legislation is welcome but does not go far enough.
Do these measures go far enough?
(disapproving) Stop it now. The joke has gone far enough (= it has continued too long).

idioms.def: to be willing to go to extreme or surprising limits in dealing with something
examples: I wouldn't go as far as to say that he's a liar (= but I think he may be slightly dishonest).
In June 2009 he went so far as to offer his resignation.

idioms.idiom: go too far | go this/that far
idioms.def: to behave in an extreme way that is not acceptable
examples: He's always been quite crude, but this time he's gone too far.
I never thought she'd go this far.

idioms.def: to the degree that
examples: That's the truth, in so far as I know it.

idioms.def: almost correct
examples: Your guess wasn't far out at all.
They weren't far out with their estimate of 100 000.
You're not far wrong when you say he's the richest guy in town.

idioms.def: to not be enough to buy a lot of things
examples: Five pounds doesn't go very far these days.
Four bottles of wine won't go far among twenty people.

idioms.def: until now; up to this point
examples: What do you think of the show so far?
Detectives are so far at a loss to explain the reason for his death.

idioms.def: only to a limited degree
examples: I trust him only so far.

idioms.def: used to say that things have been successful until now and you hope that they will continue to be successful, but you know that the task, etc. is not finished yet

idioms.idiom: so near and yet so far
idioms.def: used to comment on something that was almost successful but in fact failed

related: There is a green hill far away

meanings.def: at a greater distance away from you
examples: I saw her on the far side of the road.
at the far end of the room
They made for an empty table in the far corner.
His shot was just inches wide of the far post (= of the goal).
The sun slid behind the purple mountains in the far distance.

meanings.def: at the furthest point in a particular direction
examples: the far north of Scotland
Who is that on the far left of the photograph?
She is on the far right of the party (= holds extreme right-wing political views).

meanings.def: a long distance away
examples: a far country
Somewhere in the far regions of her mind a voice was screaming warnings.

meanings.def: a very different experience from something
examples: All this luxury was a far cry from the poverty of his childhood.

idioms.def: a very different experience from something
examples: All this luxury was a far cry from the poverty of his childhood.
